# Kibana style customization

This is a Kibana plugin to inject wet_boew_style's custom css to kibana.

## Compatibility
This plugin is known to work Kibana 6.2.4.

## Install
You should modify Kibana's *src/ui/views/ui_app.jade* in order to add the custom css to kibana's main html:
Replace line `bundleFile('commons.style.css')` by `bundleFile('commons.style.css'),bundleFile('wet_boew_style.style.css')`.
```
sed -i "s/bundleFile('commons.style.css')/bundleFile('commons.style.css'),bundleFile('wet_boew_style.style.css')/g" /usr/share/kibana/src/ui/views/ui_app.jade
```

Kibana has to find the new .css file or it will fail to start

Overwrite the favicons folder at `/usr/share/kibana/src/ui/public/assets/favicons` with the favicons folder

Then use `$YOUR_KIBANA_PATH/bin/kibana-plugin install $PATH_TO_wet_boew_style.zip` or simply copy the wet_boew_style folder under `kibana/plugins`

Restart Kibana.

### Install Canada loading gif
1. Under `src/core_plugins/kibana/translations/en.json`, change the text
2. Add the svg under `src/ui/ui_render/views/ui_app` and `chrome.jade`
3. Some changes might be needed since the logo hasn't the same format as kibana. Here's an example :
```
    .kibanaWelcomeLogo {
      background-image: url("data:image/svg+xml;base64,");
      background-repeat: no-repeat;
      background-size: contain;
      width: 90px;
      height: 90px;
      margin: 0px 0px 10px 0px;
    }

```

## Uninstall
bin/kibana-plugin remove wet_boew_style

## Development
